WorkItem.ClosedComment: As Astrylian said field is already there.
WorkItem.Description:
For hard coded gemming templates in the models could we have a Description or Name field please. The idea would be to allow 
 
					new GemmingTemplate() { Model = "Cat", Group = "Rare", Enabled = true, //Max Strength
						RedId = bold[1], YellowId = bold[1], BlueId = bold[1], PrismaticId = bold[1], MetaId = relentless },
 
to become : 
					new GemmingTemplate() { Model = "Cat", Group = "Rare", Enabled = true, Name = "Max Strength",
						RedId = bold[1], YellowId = bold[1], BlueId = bold[1], PrismaticId = bold[1], MetaId = relentless },
 
and for the display to become :
 
Group
---Name 
------icons
---Name
------icons
Group
---Name 
------icons
---Name
------icons
 
At present the display is just row of icons, followed by row of similar/identical icons followed by row of similar/identical icons. You have to hover over each gem to identify what it is, even then you get no indication why the model author placed the gems in that config. If you check the source code its often clear what the model author was thinking as their is a comment but the end user never sees this intention for the gem grouping.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] Gemming Templates to have a Names field

Comments.Message: That field is actually already there, "Id". It just isn't displayed on the editor window yet. I'll be adding it to the editor window soon.
